alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:08PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Goshen and southeastern Platte Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 408 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Chugwater, or 26 miles southeast of Wheatland. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. Very heavy rainfall east and southeast of Chugwater. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chugwater and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 48 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County
